intro: Trachyspermum khasianum, commonly known as Khasi cumin, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and cuisine, have a distinct spicy aroma and are valued for their essential oils. The botanical features of T. khasianum make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
